main_definition: The National Football League (NFL) is a professional American football league comprising 32 teams, representing the top tier of American professional football.

meanings_and_examples.definition: National Football League - Professional American football league
meanings_and_examples.example: The NFL represents America's most popular sport and includes franchises such as the Dallas Cowboys and New England Patriots.
The Packers faced off against the 49ers in a thrilling Monday Night Football game last week.
The NFL schedules games throughout the season, with each team playing every other team twice. The New England Patriots play their first home game against the Miami Dolphins on September 12th.

meanings_and_examples.definition: NFL draft - An annual event in which National Football League teams select eligible college football players to add to their roster
meanings_and_examples.example: In the NFL Draft, the Kansas City Chiefs selected Patrick Mahomes as the first overall pick.

meanings_and_examples.definition: National Football League championship - The Super Bowl, an annual American football game played between the champions of the National Football Conference and the American Football Conference
meanings_and_examples.example: The 2019 NFL Championship saw the San Francisco 49ers defeat the Kansas City Chiefs in a hard-fought battle.

meanings_and_examples.definition: NFL jersey - A shirt worn by an athlete representing one of the National Football League teams
meanings_and_examples.example: The Pittsburgh Steelers' current quarterback, Ben Roethlisberger, wears the number 10 on his NFL jersey.
